data.text:
Did you know the economic impact of Euro2024 Germany reached â‚¬7.4bnâ“ Key findings of the report (that you can download below ğŸ‘‡ ) âœ… 90% of â‚¬7,4bn was the direct result of expenditure by the 2.7 million ticket holders (44% from abroad) âœ…â‚¬571m in advertising value was generated for the host cities and the host country âœ…The 51 matches were attended by 2.7 million spectators âœ…23% of ticket holders came from the host cities, 33% from the rest of Germany and 44% from abroad âœ…97% of international ticket holders want to visit Germany again. 79% of ticket holders would recommend visiting the city that had hosted their match âœ…78% of all ticket holders rated UEFA EURO 2024 as positive, implying positive associations with the host cities and host country by extension âœ…85% of host city residents said they were proud of hosting EURO 2024 âœ…73% said that EURO 2024 had made a positive contribution to the common good and cohesion in the host city âœ…More than a quarter of residents said that they had been inspired by EURO 2024 and played more than two hours more sport than before

ğŸ‘‰ Interesting analysis in the Spanish sports industry by STROCK SPONSORSHIP & EVENT of brand categories partnering with Spanish professional football clubs to have jersey visibility: Technical categories: higher diversification reaching 9 sports brands "DNA" categories: Influence of tourism: Being Spain the second most visited country in 2023, the influence of tourism is always visible, both in airlines (4), but also destinations being advertised Endemic categories: beverages, banks, telcoms... are also some of the most regular ones in the kits this year in Spain Any similar and recent analysis of other leagues â“ Would be interesting to compare â—

â— Spanish professional football has kicked off last weekend and #LALIGA has also joined our friends from #LaLigaLoca in Norway to celebrate the start of the season Results: 1ï¸âƒ£ Kick off event in Oslo at Carls, gathering 50+ Norwegian fans 2ï¸âƒ£ Watch party viewing of #ValenciaCF - #FCBarcelona While engaging with global /local media platforms is a key strategy for LALIGA, also taking this engagement to the next level with (for instance) onsite events is highly appreciated. Congrats & thanks (again) Jonas GiÃ¦ver, Petter Veland and team for this â— #linkedINsports

Do you know any Ironmen â“ Ironman Mini MBA ğŸ‘‡ ğŸƒâ™‚ï¸ ğŸŠâ™€ï¸ğŸšµâ™‚ï¸ Not only the superhero, but those who achieve a 2.4-mile swim, a 112-mile bike ride, and a marathon 26.22-mile run, are called Ironman Yesterday in Copenhagen, Ironman took place and I went to cheer participants at the finish line. How important is to celebrate others success â“ Quite a lot. As new investor in the segment of endurance sports, I studied The IRONMAN Group growth case, worth to look at in the realm of sports Here 10 Ironman Group facts: 1ï¸âƒ£ The IRONMAN Group is the largest operator of mass participation endurance sports in the world. 2ï¸âƒ£ 1 million participants per year come to the races / events 3ï¸âƒ£Hundreds of events in +55 countries per year 4ï¸âƒ£Main target audience: Affluent individuals aged 30-40 years old 5ï¸âƒ£ Entry fees make up a majority of Ironmanâ€™s revenue at +50% 6ï¸âƒ£ Other revenue streams include sponsors, media rights, merchandising) 7ï¸âƒ£ Private US group called Advance Publications â€“ which also owns Conde Nast â€“ paid some $730 million to acquire Ironman from Wanda Group in 2020 8ï¸âƒ£ The Ironman race started Feb. 18, 1978, when 15 competitors descended on Hawaiiâ€™s Waikiki Beach to attempt the 2.4-mile swim, 112-mile bike ride and 26.2-mile run. Ironman has since expanded world-wide 9ï¸âƒ£ Participation fees are between 400 and 600 $ ğŸ”Ÿ Ironman group has been paying royalties through a licensing agreement to Marvel for the association with the famous superheroe Both for the value in the realm of the experience economy and sports tourism, i have been eager to share these facts â—

â— Happy to share i have been appointed board member at Danish Startup Group (DSG) ğŸ‘‰ An nonprofit in Copenhagen with +600 members whose mission is to engage members and startup enthusiasts in variety of events, insights and networking opportunities within the Danish startup ecosystem, also to support Danish start-ups through different means âœ… After analysing +500 start-ups over the last 5 years, investing in 9, mentoring and judging in different programs and pitch competitions in USA & Europe, i hope to further contribute and learn from one of the most innovative start-up / innovation ecosystems in the worldâ— Thanks Tomas Zhang Mathiesen & Frederik Riber Larsen, and all DSG member for the trust and opportunityâ—

ğŸ‘‰ Did you know LALIGA is back, more crowded than ever beforeâ“ âœ… All-time record stadium attendances in the 2023/24 season, reaching 16 million spectators. ğŸ“ˆ 22% growth compared to the 2013/14 season. ğŸŸ Record season ticket holder renewals, exceeding 90% as of July 31st. Several drivers of Success: ğŸ¥‡ On the Pitch: Euro 2024 winners, with 19 players from LALIGA; Olympic gold medal winners (19 players too). Off the Pitch: CVC investment fund allocated â‚¬1.994 million to club growth, focusing on stadium and sports infrastructures, digitalization, and fan experience. ğŸ“ºExcitement made in Spain but is being broadcasted around the world through several partners: TV2 Denmark TV4 Sweden TV2 Norway MTV Finland Thanks all partners / stakeholders in the Nordics for collaborating with us in growing LALIGA in 2023/24, this year, we can expect more â— #LinkedInsports #GlobalSpain #ThepowerofourfÃºtbol

The value of the next â€œcorporate influencersâ€â“FOOD FOR THOUGHTâ—ï¸ ğŸ‘‰For the last 2 years i have focused on content creation on LinkedIn, building an audience & engagement, grew +9000 followers and i was granted key opinion leader voice by LinkedIn. My main strategy is value creation for readers in the sports industry. ğŸ¤On my journey, i have connected / met with other executives alike, whom i admire for sharing my vision or going even further Highly recommmend to connect / follow (in sports). You will learn some stuff: Miguel Ãngel HernÃ¡ndez Federico Mari Andrew Petcash Ãngel J. MartÃ­nez LÃ³pez Alwaleed Alkeaid LinkedIn reached 1 billion users recently, brands selling B2B (like most sports organisations do) started to do paid media on the platform, realizing of the potential of the reach. On the other hand, growing a global community and engage with them is what most sports organization are aiming to do. Followers here donâ€™t engage because of great trips or meals. They do because the content posted is relevant to them/ the industry And i open the debate, what is the future value of the new generation of â€œcorporate influencersâ€â“ I always encourage everyone to start this journey, the value & growth that generates is endless for your professional career (contacts, convosâ€¦) for you, your company, etc.
